sub_title: Team Leader, Support to the East African Community (EAC) Regional Centre of Excellence (RCE) for Vaccines, Immunization and Health Supply Chain Management (VIHSCM) at the University of Rwanda (UR) in Kigali.
summary:
Over 28 years’ experience in programme and project management, over 25 years of long-term Service Contracts in development programmes funded by the European Development Fund (EDF) and other donors (KfW/DFID/Sida), as Technical Assistant (TA) and Team Leader for finance, procurement and contracts implementing EDF Programme Estimates (PE’s) and EDF Call for Proposals/Grant Schemes (CfP’s). Responsible for achieving programme objectives and results, coordination of programme activities, management of non-key expert assignments and reporting on programme progress including financial reports  (Rwanda, Sierra Leone, Tanzania, South Africa, Zambia, Malawi, Namibia, Uganda). 
•	In depth up-to-date knowledge of, and broad experience in, Financial and Contractual procedures of the 11th EDF, totally conversant with the EU Practical Guides to financial and contractual procedures (PRAG’s), including implementation of PE’s in compliance with the latest version of the Practical Guide to procedures for Programme Estimates (PE Guide).
•	Long-term experience in implementation of complex EU funded programmes (agriculture, natural resources management, rural development, food security, private sector development, health, infrastructure, small and medium enterprises and institutional reform, policy reform and capacity building), community development programmes and Grant Schemes.

school.name: Rotterdam School of Management, Erasmus University

education.degree_name: Master of Science in Business Administration (M. Sc. Bus. Ad.)

profile_positions.description:
Support to the East African Community (EAC) Regional Centre of Excellence (RCE) for Vaccines, Immunization and Health Supply Chain Management (VIHSCM) at the University of Rwanda (UR) in Kigali. 
The RCE’s mission is to contribute to solving existing performance challenges of the health supply chain management (VIHSCM) systems in the EAC region through the generation of knowledge and its translation into practice and policy through training and research. The project enables the RCE to achieve sustainability through building its expertise, reputation and income-generating ability, thus ensuring significant funding for the RCE’s strategic plan (2020-2029). The consulting services support the RCE with specific services related to the management of internationally funded projects (i.e. finance and procurement) and with regard to organizational and marketing tasks that shall help the RCE to become a respected research, education and advisory institution that is running on financially sustainable terms.

Specific responsibilities:
(i)	Financial Management of project funds: 
(ii)	Procurement & contracting: 
(iii)	Organizational Support: 
(iv)	Health supply chain management services: 
(v)	Other services: Supervision of a pool of experts with specific know-how, 
(vi)	Project Management.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader, Project Manager, Kigali, Rwanda
Public Financial Management Expert , Team Leader, Kigali Rwanda

company.name: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH, European Commission

profile_positions.company: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH
profile_positions.description:
Technical Assistance to Boosting Agriculture and Food Security Program in Sierra Leone (BAFS). 11th EDF (€35 million).
The Program will contribute towards the ‘Diversified Economic Growth’ objective of the poverty reduction strategy. It aims to build up a sustainable, diversified, and commercial agricultural sector ensuring food self-sufficiency, increasing exports and creating job opportunities for Sierra Leonean women and men. The Overall Objective of the BASF programme will be the reduction of poverty and food insecurity in Sierra Leone through better governance and increased agricultural productivity and diversification. 
Results: (i) Institutional capacities of The Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Food Security (MAFFS) in providing sector guidance for food security and sustainable land use are strengthened. The first BASF component aims to reinforce the Government of Sierra Leone and in particular MAFFS capabilities to foster better governance of the sector both at central and regional level. (ii) National agriculture, veterinary-animal husbandry education and research entities are strengthened, (iii) Cashew, Cocoa and Coffee (CCC) productivity and income generation for smallholders and exports are increased. (iv) Efficient and effective value chains of cash crops for export (CCC) are promoted. (v) Diversification of agricultural and livestock production is promoted. Diversification of agricultural production will help increase food security as well as the ability to withstand external shocks related both to climate change and prices instability. It will also provide a better nutritional basis for smallholders.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Team Leader, EU Finance and Contracts specialist, Freetown, Sierra Leone

profile_positions.description:
Overall management of the Rural Livelihood Development Program (RLDP) funded by the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC). The Programme aims at making market systems work better for the welfare of rural producers in the central corridor of Tanzania, applying the systemic market systems development framework, the so called M4P (Making Markets work for the Poor) approach.

As Programme Manager assuming the overall Programme management and coordination of the RLDP, ensuring the implementation of the workplan.  Coordinating and guiding the process of documentation, capitalization and sharing of experiences. Contributing to and ensuring timely elaboration and quality of Capitalizations of Experiences (CAPEX) products. Supervision and contribution to monitoring & evaluation and operational reports. Guiding and supervising the verification and closure of open contracts with partners and service providers. In close coordination with country office HELVETAS handling pending staff matters. Ensuring fluent communication with RLDP stakeholders, the country office of HELVETAS Tanzania, Swiss Development Cooperation Tanzania. Contribution to represent RLDP in important meetings and events. Convening meetings of Project Steering Committee (PSC) and supporting PSC in decision making. Ensuring implementation of revised policies, rules and regulations. Overseeing budgeting, financial accounting and financial reporting of the Programme.
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager, Rural Livelihood Development Program (RLDP), Dodoma, Tanzania

company.name: Palladium: Make It Possible, GRM International, European Commission

profile_positions.description:
Lead programme management of a human rights-based Programme funding CSO projects focusing on building social capital through capacity building and training, community-based natural resources management, climate change adaptation interventions. In close cooperation with the Executing Agency, ensure strategic planning, direction and management to promote the achievement of sustainable livelihoods through appropriate technologies and innovative approaches to rural and civil society development. 

Lead skills transfer to CSOs in project design/proposals and implementation, hands-on support, training and mentoring in grant implementation and management through a competitive grant system. Support CSOs in preparing for two calls for proposals to award grant funding against economic and management criteria: Technical feasibility of the proposed activity, geographic suitability of the proposed site with reference to natural resources, infrastructure and utilities; Financial management capabilities of the proposed action and community need for additional support; Social and Environmental criteria: Communities’ involvement in natural resource management, Potential environmental risks and benefits, Environmental mitigation measures (technical implementation, viability and costs), environment managed, protected and improved. Establish grants budget based on activity budgeting and result-based monitoring.
profile_positions.title: Technical Advisor, Finance and Contracts , East London, South Africa

profile_positions.description:
Contribute to and ensure efficient and effective implementation of the NAO support unit through the reinforcement/enhancement of national capabilities in procurement, tender and contract management. Resolve operational problems, including effective information and documents flow from project implementation with CSOs in natural resource management to donor and vice versa, timely and accurate reports cycle. 

Responsible for review of financial management systems, procurement & development of corrective actions where inefficiencies occurred. Establish procurement and tender database, which integrated EDF systems, at the NAO office. 

Finance and Contract procedures, responsible for review of financial and procurement systems. Prepared procurement guidelines in line with the donor requirements for the NAO office and all EDF financed Programmes. Established a quality control system to follow up and report on activities in line with EU requirements for contracting and procurement.
profile_positions.title: Technical Advisor Finance & Contracts expert in the NAO Support Unit Malawi

profile_positions.description:
Support improvements for rural smallholders performances with respect to food security and agricultural diversification practices through strengthened Government extension services. Specific support to natural resources management (forestry) projects for capacity building of government agriculture extension workers. Support the development of the project design following PCM and LFA, Programme implementation and closely monitoring of Programme objectives and results and indicators. 

Practical responsibilities for budgeting, financial management and procurement included 
ensuring compliance with donor financial guidelines. Support the Ministry of Agriculture staff in contracting, preparation of tender dossiers & evaluation of tenders; Establishment of financial control systems to monitor budgets and prevent ineligible expenditure. 

Responsibilities for overall Programme budget. Preparation of regular financial & Programme implementation monitoring reports for donor. At the start of the Programme, introduced a tailor-made computerised accounting system for record keeping & presentation of financial reports. 

Coordinate management of EU Grant Scheme in agriculture and community-based natural resources management implemented by CSOs. Launch call for proposals and review grant applications for focus on interventions on innovative grounds and clear marketing approach, reinforcing the strategic concepts established for the Programme. Incorporating innovative funding mechanisms in support food security action plans and intensive capacity activities. Financial monitoring and contractual follow-up of the grant contracts with local CSOs.
profile_positions.title: Technical Advisor Finance & Contracts & Imprest Administrator, Min. of Agriculture, Lusaka Zambia

profile_positions.description:
Management of a community-based, demand driven Programme including definition of the programme intervention strategy & implementing government policies. Support to innovative natural resource management projects that aimed at sustainable environmental agriculture, irrigation and soil preservation in vulnerable areas. Responsible for the design and implementation of a new implementation modality.

Responsible for grant scheme contract management. Receive grant funding requests for Projects on a continuous basis throughout the Programme duration. Technical Review of Proposals and evaluation. During proposal evaluation, intensive dialogue with implementing partners resulted in appropriate description of project implementation approaches and intended results. Grant budgets were agreed which were activity-based and result orientated.  

During implementation of the Grant, provided grant contract management and grantee specific hands-on field-based support and skills transfer through continuous and intensive team work. Support to 145 Projects in NRM, agriculture, infrastructure, environment, education, gender equality.

Responsible for programme budgeting, financial management, procurement, document management. Draft and implementation of annual work Programme budgets. During the inception of the Programme designed and introduced a tailor-made computerised accounting system, using Excel for record keeping & presentation of financial reports.

During the Programme inception, LFA techniques were used to define purpose, OVIs and results. In addition, provided advice and training on Project Cycle Management, preparation, management and implementation of Programme Estimates, procurement & financial & technical reporting. 

Support to Namibian CSO umbrella organization in advocacy roles, strategic communication, including continuous dialogue with civil society, cooperating partners, other stakeholders and government agencies.
profile_positions.title: Team Leader, Multi-Annual Micro-projects Programme, Windhoek, Namibia

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for budget coordination: preparation of budgets, drafting & implementing programme estimates, budget management, financial reporting and human resource management. Advising and assisting in definition of programme strategy, preparation of new programmes, evaluation, revision & drafting of Programme internal procedures & guidelines. 

Advised on procurement (tenders for supplies, works and services) and contracting in accordance with donor guidelines. 

Extensive cooperation with CSOs on project identification, budgeting and advocacy. Over 200 Grant Contracts, implemented by NGOs/CBOs through Grant Contracts: Agriculture, Natural Resource Management, infrastructure, and support to over 150 SMEs. Actively supported Natural Resource Management Projects within protected wildlife areas. Managed SME development through the Micro-Credit component of the Programme. 

Built local capacity of beneficiary NGOs staff in programme and project management, including Project Cycle Management, procurement and financial control. Identification of training needs and organisation of training courses for programme staff and beneficiary NGOs, including crosscutting issues. Continuous hands-on training of implementing organisations in efficient and effective project management.
profile_positions.title: Technical Advisor & Fund Manager, Micro-projects Programme, Kampala, Uganda

profile_positions.location: Uganda, DR Congo, Liberia, Croatia, Bosnia, Gaza
profile_positions.description: Coordinate and manage emergency aid Programmes in Gaza, DR Congo, Liberia, Croatia, Bosnia, and Uganda. Responsible for all financial and administrative affairs of emergency aid programmes. Financial management of large humanitarian aid programmes such as water and sanitation, irrigation and drainage, refugee-camps, health centres, feeding centres and distribution programmes of medicine and medical equipment. Responsible for implementation of donor’s funding procedures.
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager
